name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Methodology and ITP to be submitted to the Engineer and approved prior to works beginning
Frequency - Submit 10 days prior to commencement of works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre-construction levels where needed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Landscaping works to only be carried out in sections where surrounding work that will cause rework has already been completed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ensure that subcontract and supplier agreements have been completed.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ensure the area has been sprayed with herbicide. The area has died off and is free of noxious weeds, plant pests, annual and perennial weeds and grasses. Ensure at least two weeks has passed prior to planting.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39 Section D: Plant Pest and Animal Pest Control
SECTION 4 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
○ Material will be stored in stockpiles nearby to work areas where possible.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39 Section G: 3.9.1
Verifying Document - Dockets, Record of Approval
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Weed matting supplied is what is specified for the contract.
Standard / Specification - RITS Section 7.3.11, NZTA P39 Section G: 3.9.6.1
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Specfied grass to be used unless alternative has been approved.
○ Perennial rye-clover seed mix has been approved for use and will be used for all permanent grass application.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39 Section C: Site Preparation
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All plants and alternatives have been approved for use.
○ Plants to be as per the plant lists shown in landscaping drawings and schedules.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39 Section C: Site Preparation
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Topsoil used is good quality material, clean and free of debris.
Topsoil should not contain rubbish, contaminated material or pest plants.
Material will be stored in stockpiles nearby to work areas where possible.
Topsoil will be managed to prevent saturation and over-compaction.
Avoid handling topsoil immediately following any heavy rainfall events.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39 Section C and F
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Root barrier to be 1.0mm thick, 600mm high, recycled HDPE non-ribbed material.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Minimum topsoil thickness as follows:
– Swales 300mm (swales requiring 300mm to be advised by Landscape Architect)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Correct amount, size and type of plants have been delivered to relevant zone on site.
○ Supply of plants - confirm order, inspect plants for health -
○ Set up a test planting area for Landscape Architect inspection. This is to benchmark and agree typical set out (once for each planting mix/type).
○ Ensure plant spacing and plant numbers are correct.
○ Confirm application of slow release fertiliser tablets as per requirements - 3 per plant. (Photos)
○ Ensure plants are correctly planted, upright and firmly heeled in.
○ Small trees and large shrubs should be size 1.3L
○ Delivery dockets to be provided for fertiliser tablets.
○ Plants to be carried out during planting season unless approved by designer.
Verifying Document - Dockets + Inspections + Checklist + Photographs + Record of Approval
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Wetland Planting to be done outside of summer months (Dec-Feb).
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Grass seed has been applied and has full coverage in all required areas.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Site meeting held with Landscape Architect to agree specimen tree locations prior to excavation of tree pits.
○ Supply of trees - confirm order, inspect trees for health - landscape architect to check samples for compliance.
○ Ensure tree pits have been dug out to the required dimensions (varies depending on location/slope). Check no standing water in tree pits .(Photos)
○ Confirm application of three slow release fertiliser tablets per tree. Larger trees (160L) will be planted with a minimum of 8 tablets. Trees have been staked correctly.(Photos)
Verifying Document - Dockets + Inspections + Checklist + Photographs
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Areas that are mulched and been laid 100mm thick and depths have been checked. HP (Inspection at Completion)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Avoid spraying any herbicide next to streams.
○ Where required, only non-toxic herbicide may be applied near waterways and wetlands.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Tree pits to be installed as per drawings. Individual pits should be 800mm wide and 850mm deep unless agreed otherwise. 150mm soil layer beneath tree pit should be scarified/loosened. Tree pits to be backfilled with topsoil and slow release fertiliser mixed with compost. Trees to be kept upright with 50mm stakes with horizontal straps no more than a third the height of the tree. Trees to be covered with 100mm mulch and pulled back from the tree trunk.
Verifying Document - Checklist + Site Records + Photos
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Root barrier to be installed where tree pits are close to kerbs and footpaths.
○ Root barrier to installed 2m wide and to be 600mm deep where required for tree pits. (Photos)
Verifying Document - Checklist + Site Records + Photos
SECTION 6 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)
6.01.01 - Maintenance of Plants and Grassed Areas

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall remedy all defects relating to the landscape treatment works, each year during the defects and maintenance period, at the first available opportunity. All planting defects shall be addressed duuring the correct planting season.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Redline markup of any design changes.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Final tree locations to be provided.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Submitted for approval.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Planting shall achieve an 80% canopy coverage of the ground by contract completion,
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39 Section A
